title: The Directed Prediction Index
text: ↔︎️ Directed Prediction Index (DPI). Directed Prediction Index (DPI) simulation-based method quantifying relative endogeneity outcome versus predictor variables multiple linear regression models. Computation DPI simulation samples: DPIX→Y=t2⋅ΔR2=tβXY|Covs2⋅(RY∼X+Covs2−RX∼Y+Covs2)=tpartial.rXY|Covs2⋅(RY∼X+Covs2−RX∼Y+Covs2) \begin{aligned} \text{DPI}_{X \rightarrow Y} & = t^2 \cdot \Delta R^2 \\ & = t_{\beta_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot (R_{Y \sim X + Covs}^2 - R_{X \sim Y + Covs}^2) \\ & = t_{partial.r_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot (R_{Y \sim X + Covs}^2 - R_{X \sim Y + Covs}^2) \end{aligned}

text: model Model object (lm). y Dependent (outcome) variable. x Independent (predictor) variable. data [Optional] Defaults NULL. data specified, model ignored linear model lm({y} ~ {x} + .) fitted inside. helpful exploring variables dataset. k.cov Number random covariates (simulating potential omitted variables) added simulation sample. Defaults 0: case, bootstrap samples (resampling replacement) used simulation. k.cov > 0, raw data (without bootstrapping) used, k.cov random variables appended, simulation. Defaults FALSE (n.sim < 5000). file File name saved plot (".png" ".pdf"). width, height Width height (inches) saved plot. Defaults 6 4. dpi Dots per inch (figure resolution). Defaults 500.

title: The Directed Prediction Index (DPI). — DPI
text: Return data.frame simulation results: DPI t.beta.xy^2 * (R2.Y - R2.X) t.beta.xy t value coefficient X predicting Y (always equal t value coefficient Y predicting X) controlling covariates df.beta.xy residual degree freedom (df) t.beta.xy r.partial.xy partial correlation (always t value t.beta.xy) X Y controlling covariates delta.R2 R2.Y - R2.X R2.Y \(R^2\) regression model predicting Y using X covariates R2.X \(R^2\) regression model predicting X using Y covariates

title: The Directed Prediction Index (DPI). — DPI
text: \( \begin{aligned} \text{DPI}_{X \rightarrow Y} & = t^2 \cdot \Delta R^2 \\ & = t_{\beta_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot (R_{Y \sim X + Covs}^2 - R_{X \sim Y + Covs}^2) \end{aligned} \) Since \(t_{\beta} = t_{partial.r}\) variables standardized: \( \begin{aligned} \text{DPI}_{X \rightarrow Y} & = t_{partial.r_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot \left( \frac{\sum_{=1}^n (\hat{Y}_i - \bar{Y})^2}{\sum_{=1}^n (Y_i - \bar{Y})^2} - \frac{\sum_{=1}^n (\hat{X}_i - \bar{X})^2}{\sum_{=1}^n (X_i - \bar{X})^2} \right) \\ & = \frac{pr_{XY|Covs}^2 \cdot (n - k_{Covs} - 2)}{1 - pr_{XY|Covs}^2} \cdot \left( \frac{\sum_{=1}^n \hat{Y}_i^2}{\sum_{=1}^n Y_i^2} - \frac{\sum_{=1}^n \hat{X}_i^2}{\sum_{=1}^n X_i^2} \right) \end{aligned} \)

title: Correlation network plot. — cor_network
text: data Data. index Type graph: "cor" (raw correlation network) "pcor" (partial correlation network). Defaults "cor". show.value Show correlation coefficients significance edges. Defaults TRUE. show.insig Show edges insignificant correlations (p > 0.05). Defaults FALSE. change significance level, please set alpha parameter (defaults alpha=0.05). show.cutoff Show cut-values correlations. Defaults FALSE. faded Transparency edges according effect size correlation. Defaults FALSE. text.size Scalar font size variable labels. Defaults 1.2. node.group list indicates nodes belong together, element list vector integers identifying column numbers variables belong together. node.color vector color element node.group, color node. edge.color.pos Color (significant) positive correlations. Defaults "#0571B0" (blue ColorBrewer's RdBu palette). edge.color.neg Color (significant) negative correlations. Defaults "#CA0020" (red ColorBrewer's RdBu palette). edge.color.insig Color insignificant correlations. Defaults "#EEEEEEEE" (transparent grey). title Plot title. file File name saved plot (".png" ".pdf"). width, height Width height (inches) saved plot. Defaults 6 4. dpi Dots per inch (figure resolution). Defaults 500. ... parameters passed qgraph.
